SEARCH
Package gridgames

Class MouseInput

java.lang.Object
gridgames.MouseInput
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameInput, SwingIntegrated
public final class MouseInput extends Object implements GameInput, SwingIntegrated
Class implementing the GameInput interface to provide mouse support for a GameController object. Also implements SwingIntegrated since mouse events are well supported by the Swing framework.
See Also:
  • GameInput
  • GameController
  • SwingIntegrated

    • getMouseCoordinates

      public int[] getMouseCoordinates(MouseEvent e)
      Returns mouse coordinates of the user's selection as an array of two int. These coordinates are returned following the specifications given by GameInput.getMouseCoordinates(MouseEvent).
      Specified by:
      getMouseCoordinates in interface GameInput
      Parameters:
      e - A MouseEvent triggered by the user with a mouse.
      Returns:
      Coordinates of the user's selection as an int[].
      See Also:
      • SwingIntegrated

    • showTwoChoicesDialog

      public void showTwoChoicesDialog(String title, String text, String[] options, Runnable onFirstOption, Runnable onSecondOption)
      Brings up a two-choices dialog set with the specified parameters.
      Specified by:
      showTwoChoicesDialog in interface GameInput
      Parameters:
      title - Title of the dialog as a String.
      text - Main text to display on the dialog as a String.
      options - List of option labels as a String[].
      onFirstOption - Operation associated with the first option as a Runnable.
      onSecondOption - Operation associated with the second option as a Runnable.
